conclusion: Understanding the problem setup with semicylinder and ball trajectory
Point B is directly above point A, vertical distance from B to ground is R
Point B is at height R above the ground
Point C is on the semicylinder, angle between OC and horizontal is 53 degrees
OC is a radius, its length is R
Finding vertical and horizontal components of OC using trigonometry
Horizontal component of OC: x = R * cos(53°) = 0.45 m
Vertical component of OC: y = R * sin(53°) = 0.6 m
Point C is located at (0.45 m, 0.6 m) relative to center O
Ball is thrown horizontally from point B at height R
Ball grazes past point C, need to relate horizontal and vertical motions
Define variables: initial horizontal velocity v0, time t, horizontal distance delta_x, vertical distance delta_y
Find horizontal distance from point B to point C
Point B is directly above point A, at height R
Point C is at x = 0.45 m from center O
Point A is at the base, at the left end, horizontal position is 0
Set up a coordinate system with origin at point O
